Title: Area Manager, Field Safe and Secure
RoleDescription:
About Carvana
If you like disrupting the norm and are looking to join a company revolutionizing an industry then you will LOVE what Carvana has done for the car buying experience. Buying a car the old fashioned way sucks and we are working hard to make it NOT suck. I mean, have you seen our vending machine?!
We are looking for people who are excited to thrive in an environment of impactful change. Team spirit is evident at Carvana and everyday we let our passions and creativity foster innovation. We take big swings, set ambitious goals, and challenge each other to make data- and process-driven decisions in everything we do. Here are a few of our stories! Weve been changing the game since 2013, and were not taking our foot off the gas now. Want more of the story? Check out our background here. 
 
About the team and position
The Field Safe & Secure Team helps to keep our 20,000+ associates, who work at our 200+ various locations, safe and secure every day. By collaborating with various Carvana teams, the Safe & Secure Team delivers strategic planning, security program development, technology innovation, asset protection processes, data analytics, crisis management, and project management. In partnership with the Remote Safe & Secure Team and the Support Safe & Secure Team - the Field Safe & Secure Team is an integral part of our Safe & Secure Organization.
 
The Area Manager, Field Safe & Secure, will provide Safe and Secure support for a variety of operations, sites and teams, including Auction, Market Operations, Logistics, and Wholesale sites, in an assigned geographical area. They will be an integral partner for those teams providing consultation to drive risk optimization throughout the network. The Area Manager will be a hands-on leader spending the bulk of their time visiting sites and interacting with teams to drive awareness of risk issues, an understanding of core Safe & Secure Standards, and implementation of programs and processes to deliver upon the Safe & Secure mission. Through influence and collaboration, the Area Manager will drive improvement in several key metrics including unit loss rates, unit damages, inventory control compliance, fraud mitigation, and safety incidents. 
 
What youll be doing

If applicable, day to day leadership of direct report(s), inclusive of one or more Area Lead to support Field Safe & Secure. This will include recruiting, hiring, and onboarding of new hires to ensure their acclimation success. You will provide clear expectations, support through consistent coaching, and follow-up and problem-solving to situations that may arise. You will ensure an effective schedule is in place to meet goals and metric deliverables, and foster development milestones. 
Building partnerships with various operational leaders and other key business partners to collaboratively drive improvements in process execution to mitigate operational risks in an assigned geographical area of responsibility.
Leverage expertise, data, and other tools to establish Safe & Secure Standards that are in alignment with operational partner needs and are adhered to through coaching and support. 
Through data analysis, plan purposeful travel to sites to assess operational and safety risks, and work collaboratively with field partners to implement mitigation tactics and critical action steps. These visits must infuse the team with culture and performance standards that deliver the Safe & Secure Mission at every site, every day.
Helping launch new last-mile distribution locations by partnering closely with peers, the Support Safe & Secure Team, and the Real Estate Teams to ensure our teams are properly set up for success through consistent physical security designs and implementation.
Review of key risk metrics on a consistent basis to shout out success and to help coach improvements with your business partners.
Keeping every detail of your area operating like a well-oiled machine, but also taking the time to think through strategy and process with a broad perspective and make the necessary improvements to fuel future growth. 
Partner with leadership and stakeholders to assist with initiatives related to new Safe & Secure Processes and Programs to ensure strong execution at the site level.
Hybrid working environment spending 3 days per week on-site or in office at nearest Carvana location to foster spirit of togetherness and continuous learning of field operations.

 
What you should know/have 

At least 5 years of Security/Asset Protection leadership experience.
At least 3 years of directly supervising and managing a team.
At least 2 years of multi-site leadership experience.
Commitment to culture of togetherness and inclusion, and leads by example.
Proven track record of implementing change across multiple businesses/units.
Proven track record of leading teams.
Advanced change agility and growth mindset.
Advanced influencing skills.
Ability to manage competing priorities and the ability to work with ambiguity.
Ability to effectively collaborate with technical and non-technical audiences.
Strong interpersonal and communication skills.
Strong problem-solving skills with a willingness to think outside the box.
Self-starters mentality with a strong sense of urgency.
Analytical skills/mindset.
Must live within assigned geographical area and in close proximity to the nearest Carvana location.
Domestic travel required - 50% of the time.

 
Wed love it if you also have

Bachelors degree (preferably in business, finance, criminal justice, or social administration).
Project Management experience that has impacted multiple business units/locations.
Understanding of Security Technology.
Prior EH&S experience (leading program implementation and oversight).
Relocation potential and flexibility. 

 
What well offer in return

Full-Time Salary Position with a competitive salary.
Medical, Dental, and Vision benefits.
401K with company match.
A multitude of perks including student loan payments, discounts on vehicles, benefits for your pets, and much more..
A great wellness program to keep you healthy and happy both physically and mentally.
Access to opportunities to expand your skill set and share your knowledge with others across the organization.
A company culture of promotions from within, with a start-up atmosphere allowing for varied and rapid career development.
A seat in one of the fastest-growing companies in the country.

 
Other requirements
To be able to do your job at Carvana, there are some basic requirements we want to share with you.

Must be able to read, write, speak and understand English.

Of course, well make any reasonable accommodations for those with disabilities to perform the essential functions of their jobs.

RoleDescription:
Are you ready for an exciting role where no two days are the same?
At ADESA, were looking for sharp, dependable Security Guards to help maintain a safe and secure environment at our fast-paced auto auction. Our Security Guards secure all gates, check all incoming and outgoing vehicles for proper authority to enter or exit, ensure all personnel entering the facility have proper authority and secure and monitor the auction facility.
Location: 2851 St Johns Pkwy, Sanford, FL 32771
Available Shift: 2pm-10:30pm (ability to work any day of the week preferred)
Base compensation: $16/hr
Responsibilities and Duties:

Inspect the fence line for indications of unauthorized entry or potential security risks.
Ensure the offices, auction building and grounds are secured at established times. Note any security, safety or fire hazards.
Watch and report irregularities, such as fire hazards, leaking water pipes, and security doors left unlocked.
Secure gates at established times and patrol auction property. Check for unlocked doors. Maintain radio contact with the main gate.
Sounds alarm or call police or fire department by telephone in case of fire or presence of unauthorized persons.

Generate Stock-In sticker & Auction Sale Sticker (Vehicle Run Number) and apply to window.
Write vehicle run number on the passenger front side window.
Issue new run sticks for vehicles not sold in prior weeks auction and input information into AuctionTrac.

One (1) to three (3) years of security experience preferred (not required).

A multitude of perks including student loan payments, reimbursement programs, discounts on vehicles, benefits for your pets, and much more.

RoleDescription:

At our gates, you will be the face of Carvana to our associates, our vendors, and our visitors.  You will ensure proper protocols are followed with egress and digress procedures. You will be well versed on emergency procedures and will be able to provide assistance when needed. You will play an active role in ensuring our Inventory Control procedures are adhered to.
